text: <@U1KFCPFQA> I managed to test the CouchDB feature - it worked great
I was wondering why you are storing the transaction ID in the json document as well
as a reference for the transaction that created the document?
how can this be used in the future ?
I’m thinking about modifying the example so that we’re not setting an explicit document ID for the CouchDB document, but instead letting CouchDB assign the ID
also that means that documents will be later retrieved via a query with a selector
<@U1KFCPFQA> how easy would it be to do that with your example ?
I guess I need to add a new API POST method (_find) in couchdb_db.go
